title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut
notes: A bit slower than native. Mouse locked on the primary monitor in full screen, even if the window is on the secondary monitor, but works fine in (maximized) windowed mode. Sometimes needs a kill to close the game.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut
notes: Native-like performance. Audio may loop during shader compilation, but loading game save soves this problem.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut
notes: Slight stuttering (possibly when compiling shaders) Turned off all WINEDEBUG and DXVK_LOG_LEVEL for slight performance gain.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut
notes:
I had to do the registry modifications shown here: https://gaming.stackexchange.com/questions/147596/how-can-i-fix-stuttering-and-lag-issues-in-deus-ex-hr-directors-cut
to get rid of major lag spikes, after that it performs with out any issues during game play.
The game hangs when trying to exit.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut
notes: There is a stuttering problem that can be solved by changing a variable in the Windows registry found in "~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/238010/pfx/user.reg". Change "D3D11_CREATE_DEVICE_PREVENT_INTERNAL_THREADING_OPTIMIZATIONS" from 00000000 to 00000001. The game also hangs on exit.
Played Flawlessly with DX11
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

gpu: X.Org Gallium 0.4 on AMD HAWAII (DRM 2.49.0 / 4.9.0-8-amd64, LLVM 3.9.1)
notes:
Installs 4 Microsoft components.
Opens settings menu (looks like basic windows but lets you do everything you need)
Game works fine. Few lag spikes here and there, but easily playable.
Alt + Tab works fine, allows you to get back in.
Alt + F4 just clicks the exit game button, but it just crashes. I had to Alt + tab a few times to make it quit.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes:
Works perfect after two tweaks. 

Change:
~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/238010/pfx/user.reg". Change "D3D11_CREATE_DEVICE_PREVENT_INTERNAL_THREADING_OPTIMIZATIONS" from 00000000 to 00000001

and add:

PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% to the launch options
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

gpu: ATI Technologies Inc. AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics
notes: Performance seems OK even with max settings /except/ if Tesselation is turned on game crashes immediately on exiting the window.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Disable Esync + D3D11_CREATE_DEVICE_PREVENT_INTERNAL_THREADING_OPTIMIZATIONS option  removes worst of stutter. NPCs turn invisible when you get close (fixed by turning tesselation off). Turing MLAA off also helps with stutter.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Very little stutter here and there, noticeable but not hardly disturbing. Hangs on exit for about a minute or less. No registry adjustments nor proton adjustments.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Everything works through the first few story missions. All menus work, and its relatively smooth.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Run perfectly. Game hangs on quit: have to stop game process manually. Disable tesselation in game options if you're playing with old GPU to improve performance.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Runs absolutely perfectly right out of the box. I was blown away by the performance, it is as close to native as you can get.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Make sure the game is set to directx 11 mode. Installing xact for the sound and setting the dlls as native is needed otherwise you'll get totally broken spatial audio in the game.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: The sound was unbearable at first, after disabling Esync game became playable. Get good frames at 1080p on medium.
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut

notes: Load times especially poor, (loading directly from SSD takes anywhere from 4-10 mins) but it runs well enough to play
title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut
